intro: Calocephalus stowardii, commonly known as the Stoward's corymbiferous plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which are often purple or red, are arranged in dense corymbs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
